brix.title: What Brix Means
brix.intro1: Brix = sugar content in the liquid measured in percentage
brix.intro2: Slushie machines don't freeze the liquid into ice; they stir constantly, so the mixture is right at the edge of freezing.
brix.intro3: Therefore, the correct Brix value depends on how much sugar (or alcohol) is in it.
brix.typeSodaComment: Often needs adjustment as soda is a bit too sugary.
brix.typeSmoothieComment: Milk sugar and fruit give thicker mass.
brix.typeAlcoholComment: Alcohol lowers the freezing point, so you need to raise Brix to make it set.
brix.typeSugarFreeComment: Freezes too hard, so you need to add glycerin, fruit juice or thickener to avoid ice crystals.
brix.tip1: Always start with the recommended Brix value for your slushie type
brix.tip2: Adjust gradually if the consistency isn't perfect
brix.tip3: Higher Brix = thicker slush, but also sweeter taste
brix.tip4: Lower Brix = more liquid, easier to drink
